Aux:TextAnnotations.Aux:document_text: AMENDMENT TO CATERING CONTRACT BETWEEN MILLENNIUM MAXWELL HOUSE HOTEL AND TENNESSEE BOARD OF REGENTS This amendment to the Catering Contract (“Agreement”) by and between RHM Management LLC, owner of the Millennium Maxwell House Hotel (“Hotel”) and the Tennessee Board of Regents ("TBR") is made and entered into and effective September 24, 2007. WITNESSETH: WHEREAS, Hotel and the TBR agree, through this Amendment, to reflect certain modifications, additions, and clarifications to the terms and conditions in the Hotel Agreement. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration for the mutual covenants undertaken herein the parties hereby agree to amend the terms and conditions of the Agreement specifically as set forth herein: 1. Prevailing Documents. In the event of any conflict or inconsistency between the terms and conditions of this Amendment and the Agreement, the terms of this Amendment shall prevail. 2. Taxes, Page 1. Delete this section in its entirety and replace with the following: ’TBR is tax exempt and will provide a copy of their tax exemption certificate with contract documents.” 3. Reserving Space, Page 1. Delete the date references of “September 18, 2007” and add the date of "November 2, 2007." 4. Credit Arrangements/Payment Terms. Delete this section in its entirety and replace with the following: “As a state agency, TBR shall not pay deposits. All charges for space, food and beverage charges will be applied to a master bill which will be paid by TBR in full upon receipt of invoice from Hotel. TBR understands that the Hotel is relying upon TBR's banquet food, beverage, and space use. TBR shall pay any actual reasonable documented damages or loss to Hotel for which it is liable under Tennessee Law should TBR request cancellation." 5. Cancellation/Liquidated Damages. Delete this section in its entirety and replace with the following: “As a state agency, TBR shall not pay cancellation charges or liquidated damages. TBR shall pay any actual reasonable documented damages or loss to Hotel for which it is liable under Tennessee Law. Any and all claims against TBR for property damage or loss resulting from acts or omissions or TBR through its employees or agents in performing its responsibilities under this agreement shall be submitted to the Claims Commission of the State of Tennessee for disposition in accordance with the applicable provisions of the Tennessee Code Annotated. Damages recoverable against TBR shall be expressly limited to claims paid by the Commission Tennessee Code Annotated. Damages recoverable against TBR shall be expressly limited to claims paid by the Commission. Amendment Millennium Maxwell House Hotel and TBR Page 2 The function may be cancelled by either party without penalty or liability on written notice to the other party if an Act of God, court or governmental action or regulation, disaster, civil disorder, casualty, regulation, or other event beyond our reasonable control makes it unreasonably dangerous, illegal, or impossible to provide Hotel facilities for the Function or to hold the Function at the Hotel (a “force majeure event”). If either party breaches this agreement by failing to provide or utilize Function Space or Function Services contracted, for any reason other than a force majeure event, either party will be entitled to recover the actual damages that are the result of such breach, subject to Tennessee law. Please be advised that neither TBR nor any of its guess is permitted to use any meeting space or other part of the Hotel for any activity that is illegal or prohibited under any applicable law, rule, or regulation. Hotel will be liable for any loss or damage to samples, displays, property, or personal effects brought to the hotel by TBR or any of TBR's guests pursuant to Tennessee law.” 6. Governing Law/Attorney’s Fees/Severability. Delete the third paragraph of this section in its entirety and replace with the following: “This agreement is not assignable except it will be deemed assigned to any purchases of the Hotel or a controlling interest in it.” 7. Please add the following clauses: Maximum Liability. The maximum liability of the Group's Central Office under this Agreement shall not exceed $3,000.00. Audit. The Hotel shall maintain documentation for all charges against Group under this agreement. The books, records, and documents of the Hotel, insofar as they related to work performed or money received under this agreement, shall be maintained for a period of three full years from the date of the final payment, and shall be subject to audit, at any reasonable time and upon notice, by the institution or the Comptroller of the Treasury, or their duly appointed representatives. Prohibition on Hiring Illegal Immigrants. Tennessee Public Chapter No. 878 of 2006, TCA 12-4-124, requires that Hotel attest in writing that Hotel will not knowingly utilize the services of illegal immigrants in the performance of this Contract and will not knowingly utilize the services of any subcontractor, if permitted under this Contract, who will utilize the services of illegal immigrants in the performance of this Contract. The attestation shall be made on Attachment A, Attestation re Personnel Used in Contract Performance (“the Attestation"), which is attached and hereby incorporated by this reference. If Hotel is discovered to have breached the Attestation, the Commissioner of Finance and Administration shall declare that the Hotel shall be prohibited from contracting or submitting a Amendment Millennium Maxwell House Hotel and TBR Page 3 bid to any Tennessee Board of Regents institution or any other state entity for a period of one (1) year from the date of discovery of the breach. Hotel may appeal the one (1) year by utilizing an appeals process in the Rules of Finance and Administration, Chapter 0620. In witness of the acceptance of the terms of this Amendment, the parties have by their duly authorized representatives set their signatures. TENNESSEE BOARD OF REGENTS ____________k/. Charles W.
